For decades, administrations of both parties have kept these outdated authorizations on the books to justify military action in that region without coming to Congress first.

Enough. It's time we return these war powers to Congress and formally end the Gulf and Iraq Wars.

Ahead of this solemn anniversary, I look forward to voting to finally repeal the 1991 and 2002 AUMFs.

Because we are long, long overdue to have a thorough and honest reckoning about responsibly exercising Congressional war powers.

Today marks 20 years since the start of the Iraq War‚Äîa war that changed countless lives, mine included.

Many of our troops now weren't even alive when the AUMF that keeps them overseas was signed.

I'm proud the Senate Foreign Relations Committee recently acted to change that.
